DataElement.preferredName: Orthodontist Dental Retainer Device Component Difference Treatment Regimen Clinical Study Participation  Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes or No response to the orthodontist's opinion on enrolling his/her patients in a study that randomizes the patients to a different retention regimen to the one they use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Orthodontist Dental Retainer Device Component Difference Treatment Regimen Clinical Study Participation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The orthodontist's opinion on enrolling his/her patients in a study that randomizes the patients to a different retention regimen to the one they use.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dentist specializing in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of malocclusions of the teeth and their surrounding structures.

Concepts.definition: A dentist specializing in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of malocclusions of the teeth and their surrounding structures.

Property.preferredName: Dental Retainer Device Component Difference Treatment Regimen Clinical Study Participation
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.:A physical device designed to hold something in place.:The quality of being unlike or dissimilar.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to a tooth or teeth, or to odontology.
A physical device designed to hold something in place.
The quality of being unlike or dissimilar.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Response of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/15/08 - Associated NCIt concets for Yes/No instead of Meta.  Superceded existing VD.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Would you consider enrolling
ReferenceDocuments.description: Would you consider enrolling your patients in a study that randomizes patients to a retention regimen (part-time vs. full time) which differs from what you currently use

DataElement.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form
